description: A sunken forest at the bottom of the sea near Fish-Man Island, known for its Ship Graveyard and serving as a resting place for Queen Otohime's grave.
significance: A sacred and historically significant location on Fish-Man Island where important conversations and confrontations take place.

keyEvents.description: Luffy and Jinbe begin their duel in the Sea Forest to determine who should fight Hody Jones.
Robin uses her Cuerpo Fleur technique to stop the fight, emerging from the forest.

description: The royal palace of the Ryugu Kingdom on Fish-Man Island, home to King Neptune and his family.
significance: The political center of Fish-Man Island and a key location during the New Fish-Man Pirates' takeover.

keyEvents.description: Brook demonstrates his soul separation ability while imprisoned in Ryugu Palace with Zoro and Usopp.
The captured Straw Hats begin plotting their escape from Ryugu Palace.
Hody Jones orders his forces to move out from Ryugu Palace to Gyoncorde Plaza.

description: A large public plaza on Fish-Man Island that serves as a gathering place for major events and announcements.
significance: The location chosen by Hody Jones for his public demonstration of power and planned execution of King Neptune.

keyEvents.description: Hody Jones orders all his forces to relocate to Gyoncorde Plaza, setting the stage for the arc's climactic confrontation.

description: A slum area of Fish-Man Island where orphaned fish-men and those harboring hatred toward humans live. The base of operations for the New Fish-Man Pirates.
significance: Represents the poverty and resentment that fuel the conflict on Fish-Man Island, serving as the recruiting ground for Hody Jones's followers.

keyEvents.description: Residents of the Fish-Man District are ordered to move to Gyoncorde Plaza along with the New Fish-Man Pirates.
